# MiciMike drop-in PCB replacement for Google Nest Mini [MiciMike Nest Mini](https://github.com/iMike78/nest-mini-drop-in-pcb) is a drop-in PCB replacement for the ["Google Nest Mini" (Google's second-generation smart speaker with a barrel connector charging port)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Google_Nest_(smart_speakers)), but based on ESP32 and XMOS microcontrollers for running open-source firmware. Tip! If you are instead looking for a similar drop-in PCB replacement for the "Google Home Mini" (Google's first-generation smart speaker hardware with a Micro-USB charging port) then check out the sister-project at https://github.com/iMike78/home-mini-v1-drop-in-pcb

Content: Both of these are fully open-source hardware projects, taking some concep inspiration from the [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) however aiming to follow [Open Home Foundation's open voice assistants standard with Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition as reference](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) for PCB designs and specifications. # Project scope The goal of this project and repository (which is similar to the [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) but under a fully open-source hardware license) is to design a drop-in replacement PCB (Printed Circuit Board) with hardware schematics that anyone can make/build or order from a one-stop PCB manufacturer as a custom drop-in replacement PCB for the Google Nest Mini (2nd Gen). This is primarly targeting people looking to convert/repurpose their old Google Nest Mini smart speakers into open-source hardware for [Voice Control of Home Assistant](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/) and/or media player speaker output for [Music Assistant](https://www.music-assistant.io), (the hardware can however probably also be used with other applications as well with other firmware as it is based on the popular Espressif ESP32 platform). The hardware design will (similar to [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) integrate an ESP32-S3 SoC for WiFi, BLE, and [onboard wake-word detection](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (using no-code [ESPHome firmware](https://esphome.io/)) + an XMOS xCORE XU316 chip for advanced audio processing (with custom firmware for microphone cleanup offloading for better voice recognition capabilities by using using locally running algorithms for Noise Suppression, Acoustic Echo Cancellation, Interference Cancellation, and Automatic Gain Control). Functionality-wise it is made to mostly hardware comatible with the [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (a.k.a. Home Assistant Voice PE](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) reference design (which has been released as open-source hardware design from Open Home Foundation in coolaboration with Nabu Casa). The main difference will be due to constraints defined by the Google Nest Mini enclosure and comonents, (i.e. the nest-mini-drop-in-pcb project hardware design will be limited by the same type of physical capacity inputs as the original hardware from Google). As such the scope of this project/repository is not to develop new features/functions for the ESPHome firmware, so if you want that then you instead need to turn to the firmware development of the Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition as well as to the upstream ESPHome mainline code: - https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe - https://github.com/esphome/esphome - https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests ## Request for collaboration If you have some experience with PCB layout design, (and epecially with PCB routing, ground pouring, or noise-sensitive digital+analog layouts), **your help is highly appreciated**! Please feel free to open a new issue, submit suggestions/requests, and add input/feedback to existing issues, or fork this repository. For more information about the concept/idea see and contribute to related discussion also see this Home Assistant community forum thread: - https://community.home-assistant.io/t/any-news-on-alternative-to-onju-voice-pcb-repacement-design-for-google-nest-home-mini-speakers-with-added-xmos-chip-to-match-official-home-assistant-voice-preview-edition-reference-hardware/860001/ ### Current status - ‚úÖ Schematic completed - ‚úÖ Component placement done - ‚úÖ Routing is done - ‚úÖ Ground pour, shielding strategy, and EMI considerations done - ‚ö†Ô∏è 1st test batch failed on two errors - fixed - üïì waiting for the 2nd test batch
Translation: C·∫£ hai d·ª± √°n n√†y ƒë·ªÅu l√† ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªü ho√†n to√†n, l·∫•y c·∫£m h·ª©ng √Ω t∆∞·ªüng t·ª´ [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) nh∆∞ng h∆∞·ªõng t·ªõi tu√¢n th·ªß [ti√™u chu·∫©n tr·ª£ l√Ω gi·ªçng n√≥i m·ªü c·ªßa Open Home Foundation v·ªõi Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition l√†m tham chi·∫øu](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) cho thi·∫øt k·∫ø v√† th√¥ng s·ªë k·ªπ thu·∫≠t PCB. # Ph·∫°m vi d·ª± √°n M·ª•c ti√™u c·ªßa d·ª± √°n v√† kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ n√†y (t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ [Onju Voice](https://github.com/justLV/onju-voice) nh∆∞ng d∆∞·ªõi gi·∫•y ph√©p ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªü ho√†n to√†n) l√† thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt b·∫£ng m·∫°ch in (PCB) thay th·∫ø tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v·ªõi s∆° ƒë·ªì ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√† b·∫•t k·ª≥ ai c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ch·∫ø t·∫°o/x√¢y d·ª±ng ho·∫∑c ƒë·∫∑t h√†ng t·ª´ m·ªôt nh√† s·∫£n xu·∫•t PCB nh∆∞ m·ªôt b·∫£ng m·∫°ch in thay th·∫ø t√πy ch·ªânh cho Google Nest Mini (th·∫ø h·ªá 2). D·ª± √°n n√†y ch·ªß y·∫øu nh·∫Øm ƒë·∫øn nh·ªØng ng∆∞·ªùi mu·ªën chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi/t√°i s·ª≠ d·ª•ng loa th√¥ng minh Google Nest Mini c≈© th√†nh ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªü ƒë·ªÉ [ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn gi·ªçng n√≥i Home Assistant](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/) v√†/ho·∫∑c ph√°t nh·∫°c cho [Music Assistant](https://www.music-assistant.io), (tuy nhi√™n ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng n√†y c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng v·ªõi c√°c ·ª©ng d·ª•ng kh√°c v·ªõi firmware kh√°c v√¨ n√≥ d·ª±a tr√™n n·ªÅn t·∫£ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn Espressif ESP32). Thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng s·∫Ω (t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) t√≠ch h·ª£p SoC ESP32-S3 cho WiFi, BLE v√† [nh·∫≠n di·ªán t·ª´ kh√≥a ƒë√°nh th·ª©c tr√™n bo m·∫°ch](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (s·ª≠ d·ª•ng firmware [ESPHome kh√¥ng c·∫ßn code](https://esphome.io/)) + chip XMOS xCORE XU316 cho x·ª≠ l√Ω √¢m thanh n√¢ng cao (v·ªõi firmware t√πy ch·ªânh d√πng ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω t√≠n hi·ªáu micro nh·∫±m c·∫£i thi·ªán kh·∫£ nƒÉng nh·∫≠n di·ªán gi·ªçng n√≥i nh·ªù c√°c thu·∫≠t to√°n ch·∫°y c·ª•c b·ªô cho lo·∫°i b·ªè ti·∫øng ·ªìn, kh·ª≠ v·ªçng √¢m, kh·ª≠ nhi·ªÖu, v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh bi√™n ƒë·ªô). V·ªÅ t√≠nh nƒÉng, ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø t∆∞∆°ng th√≠ch ch·ªß y·∫øu v·ªõi [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (hay Home Assistant Voice PE)](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) (ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√°t h√†nh d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªü b·ªüi Open Home Foundation h·ª£p t√°c v·ªõi Nabu Casa). Kh√°c bi·ªát ch√≠nh s·∫Ω do c√°c gi·ªõi h·∫°n v·ªÅ v·ªè m√°y v√† linh ki·ªán c·ªßa Google Nest Mini, (t·ª©c l√† thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng c·ªßa d·ª± √°n nest-mini-drop-in-pcb c≈©ng s·∫Ω b·ªã gi·ªõi h·∫°n b·ªüi c√°c ƒë·∫ßu v√†o v·∫≠t l√Ω t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng g·ªëc c·ªßa Google). V√¨ v·∫≠y ph·∫°m vi c·ªßa d·ª± √°n/kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ n√†y kh√¥ng nh·∫±m ph√°t tri·ªÉn c√°c t√≠nh nƒÉng/ch·ª©c nƒÉng m·ªõi cho firmware ESPHome, n·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën c√°c ch·ª©c nƒÉng ƒë√≥, b·∫°n c·∫ßn tham gia ph√°t tri·ªÉn firmware c·ªßa Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition c≈©ng nh∆∞ m√£ ngu·ªìn ch√≠nh c·ªßa ESPHome: - https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe - https://github.com/esphome/esphome - https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests ## L·ªùi m·ªùi h·ª£p t√°c N·∫øu b·∫°n c√≥ kinh nghi·ªám thi·∫øt k·∫ø b·ªë tr√≠ PCB, (ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát l√† v·ªÅ ƒëi d√¢y PCB, ƒë·ªï ƒë·ªìng, ho·∫∑c b·ªë tr√≠ digital+analog nh·∫°y c·∫£m v·ªõi nhi·ªÖu), **r·∫•t mong nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± h·ªó tr·ª£ c·ªßa b·∫°n**! H√£y t·ª± do m·ªü issue m·ªõi, g·ª≠i ƒë·ªÅ xu·∫•t/y√™u c·∫ßu, ƒë√≥ng g√≥p √Ω ki·∫øn/ph·∫£n h·ªìi cho c√°c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ hi·ªán c√≥, ho·∫∑c fork kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ n√†y. ƒê·ªÉ bi·∫øt th√™m th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ √Ω t∆∞·ªüng/kh√°i ni·ªám, h√£y xem v√† ƒë√≥ng g√≥p v√†o cu·ªôc th·∫£o lu·∫≠n li√™n quan t·∫°i ch·ªß ƒë·ªÅ di·ªÖn ƒë√†n c·ªông ƒë·ªìng Home Assistant: - https://community.home-assistant.io/t/any-news-on-alternative-to-onju-voice-pcb-repacement-design-for-google-nest-home-mini-speakers-with-added-xmos-chip-to-match-official-home-assistant-voice-preview-edition-reference-hardware/860001/ ### Tr·∫°ng th√°i hi·ªán t·∫°i - ‚úÖ Ho√†n th√†nh s∆° ƒë·ªì m·∫°ch - ‚úÖ ƒê√£ b·ªë tr√≠ linh ki·ªán - ‚úÖ ƒê√£ ƒëi d√¢y m·∫°ch - ‚úÖ ƒê√£ ho√†n th√†nh ƒë·ªï ƒë·ªìng, chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c che ch·∫Øn v√† xem x√©t EMI - ‚ö†Ô∏è L√¥ th·ª≠ nghi·ªám ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n th·∫•t b·∫°i do hai l·ªói - ƒë√£ kh·∫Øc ph·ª•c - üïì ƒêang ch·ªù l√¥ th·ª≠ nghi·ªám l·∫ßn 2

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng s·∫Ω (t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) t√≠ch h·ª£p SoC ESP32-S3 cho WiFi, BLE v√† [nh·∫≠n di·ªán t·ª´ kh√≥a ƒë√°nh th·ª©c tr√™n bo m·∫°ch](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (s·ª≠ d·ª•ng firmware [ESPHome kh√¥ng c·∫ßn code](https://esphome.io/)) + chip XMOS xCORE XU316 cho x·ª≠ l√Ω √¢m thanh n√¢ng cao (v·ªõi firmware t√πy ch·ªânh d√πng ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω t√≠n hi·ªáu micro nh·∫±m c·∫£i thi·ªán kh·∫£ nƒÉng nh·∫≠n di·ªán gi·ªçng n√≥i nh·ªù c√°c thu·∫≠t to√°n ch·∫°y c·ª•c b·ªô cho lo·∫°i b·ªè ti·∫øng ·ªìn, kh·ª≠ v·ªçng √¢m, kh·ª≠ nhi·ªÖu, v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh bi√™n ƒë·ªô).

RowTranslations.originContent: The hardware design will (similar to [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/)) integrate an ESP32-S3 SoC for WiFi, BLE, and [onboard wake-word detection](https://www.home-assistant.io/voice_control/about_wake_word/) (using no-code [ESPHome firmware](https://esphome.io/)) + an XMOS xCORE XU316 chip for advanced audio processing (with custom firmware for microphone cleanup offloading for better voice recognition capabilities by using using locally running algorithms for Noise Suppression, Acoustic Echo Cancellation, Interference Cancellation, and Automatic Gain Control).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: V·ªÅ t√≠nh nƒÉng, ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø t∆∞∆°ng th√≠ch ch·ªß y·∫øu v·ªõi [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (hay Home Assistant Voice PE)](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) (ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√°t h√†nh d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªü b·ªüi Open Home Foundation h·ª£p t√°c v·ªõi Nabu Casa). Kh√°c bi·ªát ch√≠nh s·∫Ω do c√°c gi·ªõi h·∫°n v·ªÅ v·ªè m√°y v√† linh ki·ªán c·ªßa Google Nest Mini, (t·ª©c l√† thi·∫øt k·∫ø ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng c·ªßa d·ª± √°n nest-mini-drop-in-pcb c≈©ng s·∫Ω b·ªã gi·ªõi h·∫°n b·ªüi c√°c ƒë·∫ßu v√†o v·∫≠t l√Ω t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng g·ªëc c·ªßa Google).

RowTranslations.originContent: Functionality-wise it is made to mostly hardware comatible with the [Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition (a.k.a. Home Assistant Voice PE](https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/) reference design (which has been released as open-source hardware design from Open Home Foundation in coolaboration with Nabu Casa). The main difference will be due to constraints defined by the Google Nest Mini enclosure and comonents, (i.e. the nest-mini-drop-in-pcb project hardware design will be limited by the same type of physical capacity inputs as the original hardware from Google).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: V√¨ v·∫≠y ph·∫°m vi c·ªßa d·ª± √°n/kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ n√†y kh√¥ng nh·∫±m ph√°t tri·ªÉn c√°c t√≠nh nƒÉng/ch·ª©c nƒÉng m·ªõi cho firmware ESPHome, n·∫øu b·∫°n mu·ªën c√°c ch·ª©c nƒÉng ƒë√≥, b·∫°n c·∫ßn tham gia ph√°t tri·ªÉn firmware c·ªßa Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition c≈©ng nh∆∞ m√£ ngu·ªìn ch√≠nh c·ªßa ESPHome:

RowTranslations.originContent: As such the scope of this project/repository is not to develop new features/functions for the ESPHome firmware, so if you want that then you instead need to turn to the firmware development of the Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition as well as to the upstream ESPHome mainline code:

RowTranslations.translatedContent: N·∫øu b·∫°n c√≥ kinh nghi·ªám thi·∫øt k·∫ø b·ªë tr√≠ PCB, (ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát l√† v·ªÅ ƒëi d√¢y PCB, ƒë·ªï ƒë·ªìng, ho·∫∑c b·ªë tr√≠ digital+analog nh·∫°y c·∫£m v·ªõi nhi·ªÖu), **r·∫•t mong nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± h·ªó tr·ª£ c·ªßa b·∫°n**! H√£y t·ª± do m·ªü issue m·ªõi, g·ª≠i ƒë·ªÅ xu·∫•t/y√™u c·∫ßu, ƒë√≥ng g√≥p √Ω ki·∫øn/ph·∫£n h·ªìi cho c√°c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ hi·ªán c√≥, ho·∫∑c fork kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ n√†y.

RowTranslations.originContent: If you have some experience with PCB layout design, (and epecially with PCB routing, ground pouring, or noise-sensitive digital+analog layouts), **your help is highly appreciated**! Please feel free to open a new issue, submit suggestions/requests, and add input/feedback to existing issues, or fork this repository.

RowTranslations.originContent: For more information about the concept/idea see and contribute to related discussion also see this Home Assistant community forum thread:

Content:
## Tools used

- üõ†Ô∏è KiCad 9
- üß∞ SnapEDA / LCSC for footprint sourcing

## Known hardware specifications

- 4-layer PCB
- ESP32-S3R8 bare chip (ESP32-S3 for WiFi, BLE, and onboard wake-word detection)
- XMOS XU316-1024-QF60B-C24 (XMOS XU316 xCORE DSP audio processing)
- Dual SPI flash (as ESP32 and XMOS have their own SPI flash)
- Dual I¬≤S buses (to allow I2S interfaces at the same time, i.e. simultaneous audio output and audio input)
- MAX98357 for speaker output (I2S Class-D Mono Audio Amplifyer)
- 2x MEMS microphones (dual MMICT390200012 with 68mm inter-mic spacing)
- 6x SK6812 RGB LEDs
- Custom USB-C and 14V power input (Note! USB-C and barrel-connector can not be connected at the same time)

---

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Flashing via USB-C requires disconnecting the main 14V power input. See silkscreen note on PCB for details.

## References

### Home Assistant Voice Preview Edition resources including PCB design files
- https://www.home-assistant.io/blog/2024/12/19/voice-preview-edition-the-era-of-open-voice/
  - https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/resources/
    - https://support.nabucasa.com/hc/en-us/articles/26195279589277-Home-Assistant-Voice-Preview-Edition-PCB-design-files
      - https://raw.githubusercontent.com/NabuCasa/support/refs/heads/main/static/docs/voice/home_assistant_voice_pe_schematic_v1.0_241009.pdf
     
#### ESPHome firmware for Home Assistant Voice PE (which also use the same ESP32-S3 + XMOS XU316 combination):

- https://github.com/esphome/home-assistant-voice-pe
  - https://esphome.github.io/home-assistant-voice-pe/
- https://voice-pe.home-assistant.io/

### XMOS xCORE DSP (XU316-1024-QF60B-C32) MCU IC chip

- https://www.xmos.com/download/XU316-1024-QF60B-xcore.ai-Datasheet(3).pdf
- https://www.xmos.com/software-tools/
  - https://www.xmos.com/develop/xcore-voice

- MAX98357 cho ƒë·∫ßu ra loa (M·∫°ch khu·∫øch ƒë·∫°i √¢m thanh Mono Class-D I2S)
- 2x micro MEMS (ƒë√¥i MMICT390200012 v·ªõi kho·∫£ng c√°ch gi·ªØa hai mic l√† 68mm)
- 6x ƒë√®n LED RGB SK6812
- ƒê·∫ßu v√†o USB-C v√† ngu·ªìn 14V t√πy ch·ªânh (L∆∞u √Ω! Kh√¥ng th·ªÉ k·∫øt n·ªëi ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi USB-C v√† jack ngu·ªìn tr√≤n)
